service.name: Disability Support Pension
service.description: Disability Support Pension (DSP) is an income support payment for people who are aged between 16 years and age pension age (when claiming), satisfy the residence criteria, and either: are permanently blind, or have a physical, intellectual or psychiatric disability causing functional incapacity of at least 20 points as measured by the Impairment Tables, and have a Continuing Inability to Work (CITW), or are participating in Supported Wage System (SWS).
